name: ClubHotel Riu Garopa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again we have been to Garopa , really the best for a nice relaxing holiday , wonderful food , drink , staff so helpful everywhere so clean .The beach adjacent to hotel is amazing .So good we have been 7 times in three years , being retired it suits us so well.But don,t take our word for it try it yourself.As with other reviewers the only drawback is the flight of six hours in a cramped Thomson plane , they really should get better planes for this trip,no entertainment on plane now .Thomson say in a survey people don,t want it (don,t believe it) however on our flight there and back a meal was proved free not bad either, expect next they will charge again !!!!!!!! But still wonderful value for this Hotel .
reviews.title: Can,t be beaten for a holiday chill out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 2 months of reading all the previous reviews both positive and negative on trip advisor about the hotel and location i booked any way with an open mind and so glad i did. We had a great flight out dispite the other preivous comments we had plenty of room and my husband is 6ft . we had a free complimentary meal on both the outward and inward flight and it went very quick despite the nearly 6 hr flight we didnt notice. The hotel is spotlessly clean aand the staff cant do enough for you, our room was tidied every day for us and anything used was replaced.im a vegetarian and dont eat fish and was worried that i may struggle with what to eat, i need never have worried. There was so much choice i had something different every day and more than enough. my husband is a big fish and meat eater and he had lots of choice. we never found it to busy as other people have commented and plenty of everything what ever time you went for breakfast, lunch and dinner,We went to the African themed restaurant and the santa maria at the funana hotel and food was exellent there to. It really is one large hotel im not sure why they class it as 2 different ones as which ever one you book is exactly the same. The entertainemtn in the evenings isnt the same standard as we expect here but nevertheless the staff and brilliant dancers and try to accomodate all languages and a range of different people in their performances so i applaude them for that. Taxis to the pier in santa maria is only 3 euros if you go behond the hotel barrier as opposed to 4 if they come to the door. There is so much to do we couldnt fitr it in in the week we had and would have loved to have stayed at least 2 more days. we went fishing with fernando as a preious triop advisor had given us the information we needed and he was great, we would feingelty recommend him to any would be fisherman or woman like myself! we went on the jeep safari with thompsons and again not much to see as its very barren land but the salt lakes are well worth a vist . you do get a bit of hassle from the sellers in the streets of santa maria and we are not use to that and didnt like that part of our holkiday and infact the hotel gift shops sell exaclty the same things if not a bigger hoice and we found them much cheaper that bartering thats for sure, my advice dont waste your time just buy some gifts in the hotel and be done with it!!. we have no complaints and would and are definetly going again.
reviews.title: Anniversary holiday cape verde may 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Think of the moon or Mars and this is what you get when you leave the airport, a barren landscape devoid of life, the whole area is a giant building site very reminiceint of Spain in the 80's. But get to the hotel and it is a different world the gardens (which are still a work in progress) are green and lush, the hotel itself is clean and when driving up to it is quite impressive it reminded me of something from Arabian Nights. The rooms themselves are clean but basic, they would benefit from a makeover. The food wasn't brilliant but it wasn't bad either, it did depend on what time you went for dinner. There was quite a range of different foods catering for all tastes so even the fussiest of eaters wouldn't starve. The staff all worked hard and tried to help when asked overall if you get a good deal then it will be value for money but if brochure prices are paid then you will be disappointed. One other thing the reps are very good and are always available if you need them but don't buy the catamaran trip it costs 49 euros each and is rubbish and not worth it for only 3 hours out of the hotel.

reviews.title: Fantastic 50th Birthday Holiday
Enjoyable holiday
reviews.text: Went on a package with Thomson, had read a lot of reviews on here about how awful the flight was, but it really wasn't that bad (compared with Monarch, its luxury!). You get a meal but that's it.

reviews.title: DO NOT BE DECIEVED BY THE PICTURES! A BAD EXPERIENCE!
reviews.text: Hotel was as expected 4* (3* UK equivalent), but very clean, very spaced out, comfortable rooms, ok food & drink, lovely pool area. The only thing that was a bit strange in the rooms was the lack of a bathroom door... the toilet has a door and is private, but the bathroom area is just an extension of the room. Ok if you are a couple, but not ideal if you're there with friends or your Mum! The shower cubicle itself (has a shower curtain) is big though and a very good shower!

reviews.title: Riu Garopa
reviews.text: We were a bit disappointed with the food, seemed a bit same same and as a vegetarian I found there wasn't much choice, luckily I like salad and fruit of which there was a great choice. However there is plenty of food of all descriptions and you will never go hungry.

reviews.title: Very Relaxing Holiday
reviews.text: Lots of help yourself drink stations in the restaurant areas but I was disappointed with the 'cocktails' served in the bars, from the equivalent of a slush puppy machine.

reviews.title: Not what we expected
reviews.text: If you like cheesy evening hotel entertainment then this is the place for you (its definitely wasn't for me), but every evening the place was packed, so obviously popular!

reviews.title: Relaxing holiday, always something to do.
reviews.text: Having stayed in the adjoining hotel the Funana in Nov 2009 we new exactly what to expect from the Garopa. We weren't disappointed. Good quality accommodation, large selection of restaurants for lunch and dinner, excellent food. My wife almost overdosed on fruit and salad. Evening entertainment brilliant. Good pools, lovely beach. What more could you want. The local town, Santa Maria is very picturesque. Not much going on but enough. However, it's quite difficult to drag yourself away from the hotel entertainment in the evening, so this is not a problem.

reviews.title: ClubHotel Riu Garopa
reviews.text: This is a holiday which can be as you want it. Relaxing or if your into water sports, beach volleyball or dancing with the animation team it's up to you. I would recommend this to all ages, something for everyone.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Only down points is if you've been once then you will have seen all the sights and done all the trips. the whole island is so small. The place is slowly being built up and we were told the Hilton hotel chain is about to built a hotel in Santa Maria so that will bring the Americans with all their added trimmings, MacDonald's, Burger king, water parks etc. and probably higher prices.

reviews.title: Relaxing stay
reviews.text: I recommend going now or within the next couple of years. After that the building programme will ruin the place. This is only my opinion, some like crowds and loud people, not me.

reviews.title: ClubHotel Riu Garopa - Didn’t Know what to expect but a good Holiday!
reviews.text: The six hour Thompson flight [757] went quickly and we loved the complimentary inflight meal but there was no films or music so take your own (if you dont want to hire a Sony handheld for £7) as usual the euro rate is a disgrace (you pay £10 or 16 euros) so take sterling for on board drinks. we paid extra to sit next to each other which I still cannot understand if the seat has no extra leg room [We had an extra seat on the way back and the return journey was quicker]. The Hotel check in takes a while queing up to check in, but it only takes one person to queue until you reach the issuing of the All Inc. wrist band. The Hotel, rooms and gardens are spottless, the Buffet food was constantly refreshed in the main Resturants, you can also use the resturants in the twin hotel so there are six to choose from, four of them must be pre booked for evening meals at the reception. The Wines, soft drinks (coke, fanta etc..) draught lager [Strella], teas and coffees are also self service available. The Pool bar serve 'very popular Cocktails (not too many people over lubricated) and the beach bar serves soft drinks and lager. we booked a last minute flight to another island (Fogo) that was a great daytrip, but we would consider hunting around the Santa Mario travel agents for better deals to the other islands next time. We was so satisfied with the Hotel that we didnt find time to venture into Santa Maria much but it is worth the 3 Euro taxi fare to the Jetty to watch the days catch come in, then walk the beach back to the resort (or the cobbled broadwalk). there are some africa touts in Santa Maria that try to get you into their shops by claiming a festival or a factory shop outlet etc... (almost all the souvenirs are imported from Africa) i wish they would realise that if they didnt try to badger you into the shops they would get more customers, on contrast the Cape verde owned shops are a joy to wander around. the touts outside the beach gate are okay and can be a laugh, if you dont want the island tour or fishing trip etc..just tell them you not interested. The sea is great when (only one red flag day when we was there) you get used to the the breaking waves. the beach is a good place to learn kite and wind surfing (if you can drag yourself away from the free sun loungers and shades) we also noticed a lot of scuba diving. The breeze cools you down enough not to notice sunburn so use a higher factor than normal not to get burnt, we took Mozi spray but didnt see any but the plug in insect repeallant worked. The bar areas run out of seating after dinner so try the coloured grogue in the Barracuda Bar, you will soon be up dancing. we caught the end of the main entertainment by the Animation team a few times, that looked lively. When we flew to Fogo we stopped off at Boa Vista so may try the RIU hotel there
